select f3,f4  from t where f1=1 and f2 ='aa' order by f1,f2,f3 desc,f4;
t.f1[1],f2[aa]<^,f3-,f4
table t
position top
column f1
  where 1
column f2
  where aa
position 0
column f3
  order desc
column f4

f1 table: t,  where: 1, position: -2
f2 table: t,  where: aa, position: -1 
f3 table: t,   position: 1 
f4 table: t,   position: 2 

--------------------------------------------------------

select f1,f2,f3,sum(f4) from t where f1 between 1 and 10 and f2 like 'aa%' group by f1,f2,f3 order by f1,f2,f3,f4;
t.f1[1~10],f2[aa~],f3,f4++
#group
table t
column f1
  where 1~10
column f2
  where aa~
column f3
column f4
  aggregate  sum

f1 table: t, group: 1, where: 1~10, position: 1
f2 table: t, group: 1, where: aa~   position: 2
f3 table: t, group: 1,  order: 3
f4 table: t, order: 4, aggregate: sum
-----calc-------------------------------------------------------------------------
select f1,f2,f3,min(f4-f3) f4 from t where f2>f1 group by f1,f2,f3 order by f4,f1,f2,f3 nulls first
t.f1,f2[f1~],f3^+,f4{f4-f3}*-
#group
table t
column f1
column f2
  where @f1~
column f3
  order nulls_asc
column _f4
  calc f4-f3
  aggregate min
  order left  
--------------------------------------------------------- 
select t1.k1,t1.s1,t2.s1 from t1,t2 where t1.k1=t2.k1
t1.k1,s1#t2.k1[t1.k1]^,s1
table t1
column k1
column s1
table t2
column k1
  position hidden
  where @t1.k1
column s1 
-----------subdate------------------------------------------------
select substr(s1,1,2) from t where trunc(d1,'mm') =date'2019-02-01'
t.s1!2,d1!M[2019.2.]^
table t
column s1
  truncate  2
column d1
  position  hidden
  truncate M
  where '2019-02-01 00:00:00'
___________________________________________________
select k1,s1,s1 from t1 join t2 using(k1) 
[ t1.k1#t2.k1],s1*,*s1
relation r
  join t1
    table t1
  j k1
    table t2
    position hidden
column s1
  table t1
column s1
  table t2
__________________________________________
select n1 from t  where substr(s1,3,4)=substr(s2,-4,4)
t.n1^,s1!3!4[4!s2]
table t
column n1
position hidden
column s1
  ltruncate 3 
  truncate 4
column s2
  rtruncate 4
  truncate 4
  where @s1
